name: Marriott's Timber Lodge

reviews.text: First off.....if I had an extra $40,000 lying around.... I might just buy into their program! What a world class facility they have built. Truly amazing and well worth checking it out.
reviews.title: Everything you need to know if you're going for the sales pitch....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and two kids (ages 4 and 7) enjoyed 4 nights at the Timber Lodge. We booked well in advance and as a result, we got a one bedroom "villa". This is the first thing you need to secure. Many complaints are about the size of the room. If you don't get the "villa" you're getting a standard Motel 6 sized room. You won't enjoy it if you have kids. There is a small refrigerator and that's it. Also, ask not to be on the first or fifth floor. I used the excuse that my wife has a stange phobia and refuses to stay on the bottom or top floors of any hotel (good one, huh?). The first floor appears to have a lot of outside noise given the amount of people and the fifth floor has slanting ceilings as a result of a building restriction which requires that hotels be no higher than the treeline. I told the sales person about being on the 3rd floor and she was surprised. Apparently most people previewing end up on the first or fifth.
reviews.title: NEVER DID SEE THE TIMESHARES
Wow - Great Timeshare Property.
reviews.text: Parking is huge!! Keep in mind that it's not just the $14 per day valet charge, but also the $2 to $3 tip you will likely give each time they bring your car to you. It's safe to assume you will be looking at close to $20 per day when it's all said and done. BUT WAIT..... easy solution. As others have suggested, park behind Harrah's in their free parking lot and enjoy a 2 minute walk to the hotel. If you can request an area of the hotel to have your room, ask that you have a room that is close to room 6364. That happened to be our villa and it is super close to the parking lot since it is at the end of the building with a stairway on the end. The hotel is really large and if you get a room closer to the lobby, you are looking at an additional 2 minutes walk just to get to the end of the building.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I just returned from a 3 day, 2 night stay at the Marriott Timber Lodge. We stayed in a guest room with one king bed and sofa bed. Our unit had just opened 2.5 months ago, therefore everything was new. The room was small (just big enough for 2 people) but had a sofa bed, small refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, etc. My only peeve was that the bathroom floor was a little dirty (hair on floor). Since we were out all day, we just went to our room to sleep, so the size really didn't matter. Also, this is a timeshare, no cleaning service (except for clean towels) is provided unless you request it (for a fee). If you enjoy skiing Heavenly Valley, this is the place for you. Everything is right outside your front door and the casinos are only half a block away. Front desk and valet staff were ok, but the concierge was very friendly. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Timber Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like many of the other reviewers, we came to Timber Lodge on a timeshare promo trip. The property is wonderful, with a great location next to the Heavenly Ski resort gondola. My husband the skier can't wait to come back during ski season! The one-bedroom villa was sizeable and very nicely appointed, the staff was friendly and the required one-hour tiomeshare presentation was no-pressure.
reviews.title: Great stay at Timber Lodge Tahoe

likes.disliked: — There was nothing I liked least

reviews.text: We were disappointed that the Gondola is closed Monday - Thursday as it is non-ski season (October). If you plan to ride the gondola. be sure to check days of operation.
reviews.title: Security Issues

reviews.text: We did as other reviiewers suggested and parked at Harrah's instead of the $14 per day valet. It is a very short walk, and probably quicker than waiting for you car to come up from valet. HOWEVER, we made the mistake of leaving our car in the Raley's lot for a few hours during the day - that was a $50 mistake. Don't make the same one we did.
reviews.title: Timber Lodge is top-of-the-line

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, as other reviers have indicated, the proprty gives you $$ in the form of casino vouchers if you do the timeshare presentation. We had no problem taking the vouchers to the Mont Blue casino and exchanging them for good old US currency without having to gamble or spend the vouchers for services or restaurants. We did take our $$ and ate at the Unbuffet at Mont Blue, and would highly recommned it. At $15 per person Sun - Thurs, and $20 Sat & Sunday, it was a terrific variety of very high-quality food - not typical buffet fare by any means. Give it a try!
reviews.title: Very nice...but not a full service Marriott...definately a timeshare
